content.description: Climb and balance up to a roof on small holds before enjoying larger holds as you angle right towards the anchors. Shares anchors with the other sport climbs on this face. You can scramble up the back side of the boulder to access the anchors.
content.protection: 4 bolts and 2 bolt anchors w/ 1 chain
content.location: Left most bolted line on the West side of PK Boulder.

content.description: Anchors are easily visible from the ground. Step off a starting boulder and step off the base of a low roof. The flake is slightly hollow so be really careful of gear placed in it. If it pops out in a fall you could end up paralyzed because of landing on your back on a boulder.
content.location: Left most rout on the side that faces the creek.

content.description: Pull onto a ledge then reach to small holds while you climb through the roof which has a permadraw. Trend left on better holds to the anchors. Shares anchors with the other sport climbs on this face. You can scramble up the back side of the boulder to access the anchors.
content.protection: 6 bolts (1 perma) and 2 bolt anchors w/ 1 chain
content.location: Just left of The Fun Has Begun(middle bolt line) with a permadraw.

content.description: Fun but extremely short route. It starts on the boulder just to the right of easy street. Same deal as all the routes on this with the anchors.
content.location: Farthest right route on the boulder

content.description: Difficult and sustained moves lead up and over a small roof where the climbing eases to the top. At the time of the guide book, the anchors and first bolt had been chopped, but I'll update on that tomorrow. If they are you can stick clip the second bolt and belay off a clump of trees.
content.location: Middle of the side facing the creek.

content.description: Cruise up a weird crack that leads into fun, steep jugs.  Again at the time of the guide book the anchors had been chopped but I'll update on if they had this weekend.
content.location: First route on the side of the boulder with two trees in on it.

content.description: Climb on decent ledges and a sidepulls as you make your way up this somewhat awkward route.  The crux is standing up from a low sidepull to a jug at the top of the smooth bottom half.  Try to stay right of the bolt line to keep this route from merging with Easy Street which is only a few to the left.  Shares anchors with Easy Street.
content.location: This is the middle route on the South side of PK Boulder.  It starts just right of the classic Easy Street.

content.description: The boulder right on the PK Approach. This rock holds 4 routes.
